key_points: @realDonaldTrump, Donald Trump's Twitter account, was permanently suspended by Twitter after more than 57,000 tweets.
The suspension was due to concerns of further incitement of violence, especially after a pro-Trump mob assaulted Congress.
Trump used the platform extensively during his presidency to communicate directly with the public, bypass official media channels.
The account's messages ranged from promotional posts to attacks on political opponents and controversial statements.
Peter Costanzo, an online marketing director, helped Trump join Twitter, suggesting the @realDonaldTrump handle.
The account was used to announce major decisions and insults alike, becoming a significant tool for Trump's communication.
Twitter flagged 471 of Trump's tweets for misinformation in his final months on the platform.
The account's suspension followed Trump's controversial usage for spreading misleading claims and attacking various targets.
Donald Trump Jr. criticized Twitter for banning his father while allowing leaders of authoritarian regimes to remain on the platform.
Historians may look back on @realDonaldTrump's tweets as a window into Trump's thoughts and presidency.
spokespersons: Donald Trump Jr. (Donald Trump's eldest son)
